title: [UL2] How can I reproduce the in-context few-shot results?
body:
Hi, I would like to reproduce the results listed in table10 and table11 of the [UL2 paper](https://arxiv.org/abs/2205.05131).
I did some experiments with UL2 20B and most of resulted scores were lower than the paper's. ex) `SuperGLUE-copa` & `rte`, `XSUM`  
So I have some questions with respect to reproducing your results. (or nearly the same)

1. Should I use the appropriate instruction when configuring the prompt? 
    ex) `"After reading this passage, I have a question: {question}? True or False?"` for SuperGLUE-boolq
2. Did you use the sentinel token when running few-shot experiment just like one in a pre-trained manner?
3. Should I do any post-processing like normalization? 
    ex) As far as I know, in the GPT-3 paper, authors normalized the unconditional probability of each completion, by computing `{P(completion|context)/P(completion|answer context)}`.
4. For SuperGLUE tasks, did you use perplexity to decide the best option?
5. For XSUM task, what decoding strategy did you use? 
    ex) simple greedy decoding, beam search, ... 

Thanks.
